entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 1:26AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: .An atmospheric river has brought widespread heavy rainfall across Southeast Alaska. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:28PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From Utqiagvik East Tonight Into Friday... Northwest winds increasing to 20 mph along the Arctic Coast near Utqiagvik tonight will continue into Thursday and spread east along the Arctic coast. Winds will then turn west on Thursday night and continue into Friday. This will likely cause elevated surf along the Arctic Coast at Utqiagvik from this evening through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.
